New Records: Jaden Hardy scored a season-high 25 points off the bench
P.J. Washington had 23 points and 14 rebounds
Dereck Lively II added season highs with 21 points and 16 rebounds
Key Match Events: Dallas used a late 16-0 run to rally past Portland Trail Blazers 117-111
Washington hit two free throws tying the score at 109-109 with 2:26 left and followed with a right-corner 3-pointer for a 112-109 lead with 1:58 to go
Quentin Grimes tipped back Spencer Dinwiddieâ€™s miss with 40 seconds left, then turned a one-hand heave into a three-point play to complete the 16-point run at 115-109 with 31.8 seconds left
Pre-Game Insights: Dallas has won two straight following a season-long five-game losing streak
Anfernee Simons and Shaedon Sharpe each scored 22 points to lead the Blazers
Mavericks: Hardy, averaging 7.6 points per game this season, has averaged 18.0 over the past four games
Post-Match Reflections: Portland led 109-99 with 4:33 to play but then missed its next six field-goal attempts and committed two turnovers
Key stat: Dallas, playing without its best outside shooters, outscored Portland 58-38 in the paint
Up next: The Blazers host Miami on Saturday night. The Mavericks will play the first of consecutive home games against Denver on Sunday
